meanings.definition: A person who gives approval or support.
meanings.sent1: My friend is always a kind countenancer of my ideas.
meanings.sent2: The countenancer of the project was impressed by the team's effort.
meanings.sent3: The countenancer at the meeting nodded in agreement with every suggestion.
meanings.sent4: She was like a bright countenancer, shining positivity on everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The countenancer's smile was like a warm ray of sunshine on a cloudy day.

meanings.definition: To support or approve of something.
meanings.sent1: I will countenancer your decision to pursue your dreams.
meanings.sent2: The teacher countenancered the student's choice to study extra hours.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to countenancer the idea of a nap on the cozy blanket.
meanings.sent4: Her actions countenancered her words, showing true dedication.
meanings.sent5: The crowd's cheers countenancered the athlete's determination to win.

meanings.sent1: I cannot countenancer such disrespectful behavior in my classroom.
meanings.sent2: The company policy does not countenancer any form of discrimination.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy tried to countenancer chewing on the shoe.
meanings.sent4: His patience was a countenancer for the chaos around him.
meanings.sent5: The peaceful town would not countenancer any violence within its borders.
